Selected References

Source: ../vignettes/Selected_References.Rmd
Selected_References.Rmd

The following is a selected list of references relating to Dynamic TOPMODEL, in implimentation in R and interesting applications.

The basis of Dynamic TOPMODEL

Keith Beven and Jim Freer, “A Dynamic Topmodel,” Hydrological Processes 15, no. 10 (2001): 1993–2011, https://doi.org/10.1002/hyp.252.

Implimentations in R

Peter Metcalfe, Keith Beven, and Jim Freer, “Dynamic Topmodel: A New Implementation in R and Its Sensitivity to Time and Space Steps,” Environmental Modelling & Software 72 (2015): 155–72, https://doi.org/https://doi.org/10.1016/j.envsoft.2015.06.010.

Applications

Natural Flood Management

Peter Metcalfe et al., “A Modelling Framework for Evaluation of the Hydrological Impacts of Nature-Based Approaches to Flood Risk Management, with Application to in-Channel Interventions Across a 29-Km2 Scale Catchment in the United Kingdom,” Hydrological Processes 31, no. 9 (March 2017): 1734–48, https://doi.org/10.1002/hyp.11140.

P. Metcalfe et al., “A New Method, with Application, for Analysis of the Impacts on Flood Risk of Widely Distributed Enhanced Hillslope Storage,” Hydrology and Earth System Sciences 22, no. 4 (2018): 2589–2605, https://doi.org/10.5194/hess-22-2589-2018.

Peter Metcalfe et al., “A New Method, with Application, for Analysis of the Impacts on Flood Risk of Widely Distributed Enhanced Hillslope Storage,” Hydrology and Earth System Sciences 22, no. 4 (April 2018): 2589–2605, https://doi.org/10.5194/hess-22-2589-2018.
